item.title: Chilling

The conversation turned to the heatwave in Siberia (you might have missed it, cataclysmic climate news rarely makes the, er, news), and I mentioned the assertion by Professor Kevin Anderson that we need to ditch carbon fuel by 2035.

item.title: Principles
item.author: hello@growdigital.org (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Had a #ForestGarden tour on Monday, these are my 3 key principles of setting up a forest garden:

item.title: Gamification
item.author: hello@growdigital.org (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Saw my friend Antony for coffee yesterday, very interesting conversation about gaming. I have a free mini-course on how to plan your forest garden for which I‚Äôd like to set up a discussion forum.

item.title: Nuttery
item.author: hello@growdigital.org (Jake Rayson)
item.description: My #ForestGarden days are varied: designing in the morning, planting in the afternoon, writing in the evening.

item.title: Positive
item.author: hello@growdigital.org (Jake Rayson)
item.description: @KatCardy said ‚ÄúSpend your energy not fighting what you dislike, but in building what you love.

item.title: Sampling bias
item.author: hello@growdigital.org (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Listening to Susannah Maidment on A Life Scientific podcast, talking about dinosaurs and stegosaurs.

item.title: Penny
item.author: hello@growdigital.org (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Found this old penny coin whilst planting in the #ForestGarden #Nuttery. The date is 1939 and it‚Äôs in remarkably good condition.

item.title: Beautiful
item.author: hello@growdigital.org (Jake Rayson)
item.description: All plants are beautiful. @carolekirk‚Äôs small forest garden. Ornamental, edible, sustainable.

item.title: Experts
item.author: hello@growdigital.org (Jake Rayson)
item.description: ‚ÄúOne wonders how much further along we would be with meaningful climate change mitigation, if the experts were creating and enforcing environmental policy globally, instead of politicians.

item.title: Native
item.author: hello@growdigital.org (Jake Rayson)
item.description: ‚Äúwe need to give local plant and animal populations as much chance to evolve and adapt as possible for as long as we can‚Ä¶ This means using local native plants with immediate or nearby genetic origins, plants wildlife and insects can recognize‚Äù

item.title: Looks
item.author: hello@growdigital.org (Jake Rayson)
item.description: I‚Äôm having big, sweary outbursts whilst reading Planting: A New Perspective by Noel Kingsbury and Piet Oudolf.

item.title: Chaos
item.author: hello@growdigital.org (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Chaos is not disorder Chaos is unpredictable patterns It is not random Design is not how something looks

item.title: Dead hedge again
item.author: hello@growdigital.org (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Lovely time yesterday building dead hedges with Liz in an orchard, in preparation for some major pruning in a couple of weeks.

item.title: Catalyst
item.author: hello@growdigital.org (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Some people are catalysts and Sarah Wilson is one of them. In her latest @rootsandall podcast with Fergus Garrrett from Great Dixter, they talk about biodiversity audits at the gardens.

item.title: Vogt
item.author: hello@growdigital.org (Jake Rayson)
item.description: ‚Äúfighting for justice on behalf of plants, animals, and ecosystems is directly related to the fight made for women, people who aren’t white, people who aren’t straight, people who live in poverty, people who don’t practice Christianity etc.

item.title: Dominion
item.author: hello@growdigital.org (Jake Rayson)
item.description: ‚ÄúBe fruitful and multiply and fill the earth and subdue it, and have dominion over the fish of the sea and over the birds of the heavens and over every living thing that moves on the earth.

item.title: Patriarchy
item.author: hello@growdigital.org (Jake Rayson)
item.description: ‚ÄúPatriarchy isn‚Äôt working for us.‚Äù @AlysFowler on @AndrewTimothyOB‚Äôs Garden‚Äôs Weeds & Words podcast. The inclination to control plants, destroy pests, to have dominion over every living thing, this runs deep in the monotheistic, Judeo-Christian and patriarchal tradition.

item.title: Thomas Rainer
item.author: hello@growdigital.org (Jake Rayson)
item.description: Excellent slideshow and article from Thomas Rainer about modular garden design thomasrainer.com/blog/modular-planting-design-random-by-design. My notes:

item.title: Vegan bacon
item.author: hello@growdigital.org (Jake Rayson)
item.description: OMG! Simple #vegan bacon that tastes like bacon! Thank you @bonappetegan for the idea, which is slightly browned banana peel with the white bits scraped off with a teaspoon, then marinaded for a while in a smoky, salty sauce, then fried.

item.title: Evidence-based gardening
item.author: hello@growdigital.org (Jake Rayson)
item.description: #EvidenceBasedGardening is wildlife gardening based on evidence! The majority of gardeners want to help wildlife but often don‚Äôt know which plants are most beneficial, when to intervene eg pruning or deadheading, or what native plants do best in their area.
